Executive Order.definition: an order issued by a government's executive on the basis of authority specifically granted to the executive branch
Executive Order.origin: [the National Security Agency was created by an executive order ]

1.1: an order issued by a government's executive on the basis of authority specifically granted to the executive branch (as by the U.S. Constitution or a congressional act) [the National Security Agency was created by an
1.note: An executive order from the president does not have the force of law until it is printed in the Federal Register.
